title: Build Aboveground Solar Still
brief: Construct a solar still using plastic bag and vegetation to extract moisture, producing 0.5-1 liter in 24 hours.
steps: Step 1: Find a sunny slope location for optimal solar heating of the still.
Step 2: Obtain a clear plastic bag, green leafy vegetation, and a small rock.
Step 3: Fill the plastic bag with air by turning opening into breeze or scooping air into bag.
Step 4: Fill the bag half to three-fourths full with green leafy vegetation.
Step 5: Remove all hard sticks or sharp spines that might puncture the plastic bag.
Step 6: Place small rock in bottom corner of bag to create collection point.
Step 7: Seal the bag tightly and place on sunny slope.
Step 8: Allow 24 hours for water collection - expect 0.5 to 1 liter output.
warnings: Requires full 24 hours to produce adequate water - plan accordingly.
Remove all sharp objects that could puncture the bag.
Only use non-poisonous vegetation in the still.
source: FM21-76 US Army Survival Manual — U.S. Department of the Army (Chapter 6 - Water Procurement)
